content.description: A thin finger crack with good pro on the left side of the wall. The first piece is quite a bit off the ground so be careful, great gear after that.
content.protection: gear to 2", stoppers, belay at anchors for the dude
content.location: Route is on the left side of the identity wall, look for a thin crack at the top. just left of the dude.

content.description: This is the left facing corner next to classic crack. A very similar climb, although probably not as classic.
content.location: Located on the far left side of the identity wall, right of classic crack

content.description: Heads up the left leaning flared crack, then climb the white face up to the right, and finally exit right.
content.protection: small to medium gear, stoppers, chain anchors
content.location: route is on the right side of the identity wall, look for the rightmost crack.

content.description:
An awesome moderate trad route with nearly a 20 foot horizontal overhung crack. While it looks like an off-width from the ground narrowing to hands, there are good holds within the roof crack. Gear is plentiful.

The climbing from the cracks to the right of the dihedral to the roof is nothing more than 5.9, but its super enjoyable.
content.protection:
A single rack up to #4 BD Camalot.

Rap off of slung tree with permanent carabiners.
content.location: Walk around left of Classic Crack for a hundred feet or so until you find the large overhung crack. It is next to a 5.8+ route with 3 bolts at the top.

content.description: This is the face climb in the middle of the wall. Heads up through thin crimpy moves that are more difficult than they look. sustained and technical.
content.location: route is located left of cube root and right of identity crisis. the only all bolt line on this part of the wall.

content.description: Route heads up the arete just left of weiner pigs, steep and tricky.
content.protection: quickdraws, small cams for the bottom, belay from the anchors for the dude
content.location: the arete on the left side of the identity wall proper, between weiner pigs and arms race.

content.description: This route is the direct start to identity crack. Head up thin face through a few bolts to tricky moves,then pull onto the slab and traverse right to get into the identity crack.
content.protection: small to medium gear, stoppers, quickdraws, chain anchors
content.location: Route starts just left of identity crack, bolted thin face to thin splitter up top.

content.description: Start in flared left leaning crack and then step left to the thin splitter that heads left even more. great all gear line.
content.protection: small to medium gear, stoppers, chain anchors
content.location: this is the crack on the right side of the identity wall. same start as for square root.

content.description: This pitch heads up the left facing corner from the ledge. Go up the corner, then step left. Pull the roof to continue up steep upper face to the arete.
content.location: This route starts at the ledge with the top anchors for The Dude. The left of the two bolted lines.

content.description: A spectacular second pitch variation to The Dude anchors, head directly up from the anchor towards a small corner. Pull up the face to get under the roof, then some awkward but good moves to pull the roof. Continue up easy ground on the arete to the anchors.
content.location: This route starts at the top anchors for The Dude, and is the right of the two bolted lines.

content.description:
A classic 5.11, semi-flaring, offset crack that angles up and left.  Pro is very select and very critical.  I'm not saying it's bad or not there--It's 5.11. This can also be toproped with a one directional from the 5.9,

Arms Race

around the corner.

The second pitches following both bolt lines are exquisite.  11b, and good.
content.protection: A bolt and good selection of gear.
content.location:
Located on the

Identity Wall

just below

Pleasant Surprise.

content.description: The right-most climb on wall. Easy climbing up large crack onto face split by thin crack; awkward moves past bulges gain ledge with 2-bolt anchor. Difficult to protect on lead.
content.protection: Small wires and TCUs to 2-bolt anchor

content.description:
Possibly the most climbed route in all of

Kootenai

.  This is great for beginners as well as a first trad lead.  The climbing can get pretty greasy at times do to the amount of traffic it recieves.
content.protection: Camalots ranging from .5 to 3,  nuts work great, this crack will eat just about anything.
content.location:
The left-most climb on the

Identity Wall

, marked by a large right-facing dihedral.

content.description:
Great over hanging crack on the

Identity Wall

; short but sweet!
content.protection: singles of finger to hand sized pieces
content.location:
The left side of

Identity Wall
